brief.content-text: The animation depicts the encapsulation process and protocol operation when sending a web page from a Web server to a Web client over an Ethernet network. The client requests a Web page, and the server sends the web page to the client. The Web page data is encapsulated with a TCP transport header, which creates the TCP Segment. Next, the TCP Segment is encapsulated in an IP header creating a packet. Then the Ethernet frame header and trailer encapsulate the IP packet, creating an Ethernet frame. Finally, the Ethernet frame is transmitted on the medium as bits (zeros and ones).
